definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
competitive election (i.e. with more candidates than seats)
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of flag-waving activists called for early elections.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计挥舞着国旗的积极分子要求提早进行选举。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝贺我的邻居，他的儿子刚刚赢得选举。

sentences.english: We have hundreds of constituencies and the votes in each one ele …
sentences.chinese: 我们有数百个选区，每个选区通过投票议会选举。

sentences.english: Muscovites vote in the Russia's first presdential elections. Incumbent Russian President Boris Yeltsin defeated.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科，俄罗斯的第一次总统选举投票。

sentences.english: The result of the election has been published.
And when election day dawns at last, Hamas will still be there.
sentences.chinese: 而当选举那天终于到来时，哈马斯仍会留在加沙。

sentences.english: The law deprives criminals of their right to vote.
sentences.chinese: 法律剥夺了罪犯的选举权。

sentences.english: The 435 members of the House are elected every two years.
sentences.chinese: 最少每五年举行一次普选来选举下议院议员。

sentences.english: The candidates are running neck and neck in this election.
sentences.chinese: 这场选举中候选人难分高下。

sentences.english: If I win the election, I will carry out God's will.
sentences.chinese: 如果我赢得这次选举，我会替天行道。

sentences.english: The fear is that the next election, due next year, will follow the same course.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕明年的下一轮选举也难逃相同的厄运。

sentences.english: The election is the Philippines' first using an electronic vote-counting system.
sentences.chinese: 这此选举是菲律宾第一次采用电子计票系统。

sentences.english: It looks like the President received illegal campaign donations.
sentences.chinese: 总统好像收受了非法的选举贿金。

sentences.english: This election was not canonical , and was not approved by the pope.
sentences.chinese: 这次选举是不典型，以及不获批准，由教宗。

sentences.english: An election must take place, by law, at least every five years.
sentences.chinese: 根据法律规定，至少每五年举行一次选举。

sentences.english: Both Rendell and Casey have put their prestige on the line in this election.
sentences.chinese: 伦德尔和凯西的威望和他们的选举倾向一致。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
